nealrichardson commented on issue #6868: ARROW-8369: [CI] Fix crossbow wildcard groups
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6868#issuecomment-610721717
 
 
   @kszucs @wesm A few things I've noticed:
   
   1. Apparently you can't start a glob with `*`. Maybe that's a yaml thing? Maybe not. Didn't try to debug.
   2. If you have a group that has a glob pattern and then something else, only the first glob is used. In the R task list above, there are two entries in the group definition, and the second one (`macos-r-autobrew`) was not included.
   3. The nightly group fails (see [here](https://github.com/apache/arrow/runs/569544168?check_suite_focus=true)), my guess is that the greedy pattern matching is pulling in jobs that we weren't including previously and that don't actually work.
   4. Y'all should do an audit of what's included and what isn't. I fixed a handful of discrepancies between what was run before and what is being run now (assuming of course that they run), but there may be more. And as (3) suggests, there may be stale, broken tasks in the yaml that should be cleaned out.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

kszucs commented on issue #6868: ARROW-8369: [CI] Fix crossbow wildcard groups
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6868#issuecomment-610939411
 
 
   > @kszucs @wesm A few things I've noticed:
   > 
   > 1. Apparently you can't start a glob with `*`. Maybe that's a yaml thing? Maybe not. Didn't try to debug.
   Yes, that is reserved for YAML anchors. If use enclose it with quotes then yaml will treat it as string so it will work.
   > 2. If you have a group that has a glob pattern and then something else, only the first glob is used. In the R task list above, there are two entries in the group definition, and the second one (`macos-r-autobrew`) was not included.
   That's because I renamed `macos-r-autobrew`  to `homebrew-r-autobrew` ala the existsing `homebrew-cpp-autobrew` - so `macos-r-autobrew` doesn't exists anymore.
   > 3. The nightly group fails (see [here](https://github.com/apache/arrow/runs/569544168?check_suite_focus=true)), my guess is that the greedy pattern matching is pulling in jobs that we weren't including previously and that don't actually work.
   I'm investigating this.
   > 4. Y'all should do an audit of what's included and what isn't. I fixed a handful of discrepancies between what was run before and what is being run now (assuming of course that they run), but there may be more. And as (3) suggests, there may be stale, broken tasks in the yaml that should be cleaned out.
   I'm trying to add a subcommand to validate the configuration.
   
   
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

kszucs commented on issue #6868: ARROW-8369: [CI] Fix crossbow wildcard groups
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6868#issuecomment-610939411
 
 
   > @kszucs @wesm A few things I've noticed:
   > 
   > 1. Apparently you can't start a glob with `*`. Maybe that's a yaml thing? Maybe not. Didn't try to debug.
   
   Yes, that is reserved for YAML anchors. If use enclose it with quotes then yaml will treat it as string so it will work.
   > 2. If you have a group that has a glob pattern and then something else, only the first glob is used. In the R task list above, there are two entries in the group definition, and the second one (`macos-r-autobrew`) was not included.
   
   That's because I renamed `macos-r-autobrew`  to `homebrew-r-autobrew` ala the existsing `homebrew-cpp-autobrew` - so `macos-r-autobrew` doesn't exists anymore.
   > 3. The nightly group fails (see [here](https://github.com/apache/arrow/runs/569544168?check_suite_focus=true)), my guess is that the greedy pattern matching is pulling in jobs that we weren't including previously and that don't actually work.
   
   I'm investigating this.
   > 4. Y'all should do an audit of what's included and what isn't. I fixed a handful of discrepancies between what was run before and what is being run now (assuming of course that they run), but there may be more. And as (3) suggests, there may be stale, broken tasks in the yaml that should be cleaned out.
   
   I'm trying to add a subcommand to validate the configuration.
